propertyGroup.name: Outlets
propertyGroup.documentation: Defines the locations to which output is generated.

property.name: shared-configuration-struts2
property.documentation: The location to which Struts 2 configuration files are generated. These are the files that typically appear in WEB-INF/classes.

property.name: controleAcesso
property.documentation: Diretorio onde os artefados de controle de acesso sera gerados

property.name: controleAcessoImpl
property.documentation: Diretorio onde os artefados de controle de acesso sera gerados

property.name: controleAcessoImplJava
property.documentation: Diretorio onde os artefados de controle de acesso sera gerados

property.name: controleAcesso-config
property.documentation: Diretorio onde os arqivos de configuracao do controle de acesso estão

property.name: session-objects
property.documentation: Diretorio onde os session objects serao gerados

property.name: layout-util
property.documentation: Diretorio onde o arquivo de cargado perfil e gerado

property.name: layout-util-impl
property.documentation: Diretorio onde o arquivo de cargado perfil e gerado

property.name: principal-controleAcesso
property.documentation: Diretorio onde os artefados de controle de acesso do modulo principal

property.name: project-configuration
property.documentation: Diretorio onde os artefados do maven para modulos serão gerados

property.name: shared-configuration
property.documentation: Diretorio onde os artefados de configuração compartilhados serão gerados

property.name: actions
property.documentation: The location to which Struts actions are generated.

property.name: shared-actions
property.documentation: The location to which shared Struts actions are generated.

property.name: shared-actions-impl
property.documentation: The location to which shared Struts actions are generated.

property.name: manageable-models
property.documentation: The location to which crud models of manageable entities are generated.

property.name: actionsImpl
property.documentation: The location to which Struts actions impl are generated.

property.name: forms
property.documentation: The location to which Struts action forms are generated.

property.name: configuration
property.documentation: The location to which Struts configuration files are generated. These are the files that typically appear in WEB-INF, such as validation-rules.xml and tiles-defs.xml.

property.name: controllers
property.documentation: The location to which abstract controllers are generated.

property.name: controller-impls
property.documentation: The location to which the controller implementation classes are generated.

property.name: messages
property.documentation: The location to which message resource bundles are generated.

property.name: messages-modulo
property.documentation: Localização para onde são geradas as mensagens relativas a cada módulo WEB.

property.name: custom-messages
property.documentation: The location to which custom message resource bundles are generated.

property.name: util
property.documentation: The location to which util classes are generated.

property.name: pages
property.documentation: application JSP pages, login pages and stylesheets are outputted here

property.name: custom-pages
property.documentation: Diretório com as páginas customizadas.

property.name: shared-pages
property.documentation: application shared JSP pages, login pages and stylesheets are outputted here

property.name: shared-pages-impl
property.documentation: application shared JSP pages, login pages and stylesheets are outputted here

property.name: server
property.documentation: The location where to store application server specific configuration, such as users.properties and roles.properties (in case security has been enabled)

property.name: decorators
property.documentation: The location where the displaytag table decorators will be generated (if any). Files generated into this outlet will not be overwritten upon regeneration, they are meant to be edited by hand.

property.name: layout-configuration
property.documentation: Local onde as configurações do layout (cabeçalho, css, rodapé) são armazenadas.

property.name: view-test
property.documentation: Place which the View Test files will be generated.

property.name: view-test-impl
property.documentation: Place which the View Test files will be generated.

property.name: view-test-configuration
property.documentation: Place which the View Test configuration files will be generated.

property.name: statistics
property.documentation: Place which the reports will be placed. Use for internal statistics.

property.name: projectDir
property.documentation: Project's base directory.

property.name: defaultCrudPackage
property.documentation: Default CRUD package name.

property.name: viewTestEnabled
property.documentation: View Test page load.

property.name: viewTestPageLoad
property.documentation: View Test page load.

property.name: viewTestServerHost
property.documentation: View Test application server host.

property.name: viewTestServerPort
property.documentation: View Test server port.

property.name: viewTestBrowser
property.documentation: View Test browser to be used.

property.name: viewTestApplicationHost
property.documentation: View Test application server URL.

property.name: viewTestApplicationPort
property.documentation: View Test application server URL.

property.name: viewTestAccessControlDir
property.documentation: View Test access control directory.

property.name: viewTestBasicDir
property.documentation: View Test directory.

propertyGroup.name: JSP pages
propertyGroup.documentation: Properties that directly affect the code generated into the JSPs.

property.name: preventDirectPageAccess
property.documentation: By enabling this property the cartridge will make sure JSPs are not accessible directly by the client: only the server can access them this way. It is generally good practice to enable it since only Struts actions are called but for some reason behavior is different on different machines, so we allow this feature to be toggled. Set to true if you want to prevent direct access to pages.

property.name: defaultDateFormat
property.documentation: The default date format to use in case it has not been explicitely specified, for event parameters. Take a look here to see how to properly construct date formats.

property.name: strictDateTimeFormat
property.documentation: Specifies whether or not date and time formats are to be strictly matched. This property takes either true or false as values. If set to true all dates and times entered by the end-user will fail validation if they do not strictly adhere to their given format. Note that this strictness can always be overriden locally using the @andromda.struts.view.field.format tagged value.

property.name: defaultTimeFormat
property.documentation: The default time format to use when it has not been explicitely specified for event parameters. Take a look here to see how to properly construct time formats.

property.name: defaultInputColumnCount
property.documentation: If specified denotes the default length of text input fields, the value specifies the size attribute of the corresponding input or textarea element. Not speciying any valid value will make the cartridge ignore it and resort to the default browser value by not rendering any size attribute.

property.name: defaultInputRowCount
property.documentation: If specified denotes the default number of rows of textarea elements. Not speciying any valid value will make the cartridge ignore it and resort to the default browser value by not rendering any size attribute.

property.name: defaultTableExportTypes
property.documentation: The types of files to which a table can be exported.

property.name: xhtml
property.documentation: Whether or not xhtml should be rendered, as opposed to regular HTML.

property.name: welcomeFileName
property.documentation: The name of the JSP that is the welcome file.

property.name: maxBreadCrumbs
property.documentation: An integer denoting the maximum number of breadcrumbs to appear on a page, specify zero to disable breadcrumbs

property.name: onlineHelp
property.documentation: Denotes whether or not to render online help pages.

property.name: hints
property.documentation: Whether or not hints should be rendered in the generated JSP pages.

property.name: setPageVariablesInPageScope
property.documentation: Whether or not form page variables are copied into page scope.

propertyGroup.name: Manageable Entities
propertyGroup.documentation: Properties related to the generation of the web-tier part of the manageable entities (also known as the CRUD feature).

property.name: manageableFormName
property.documentation: Defines the name of the form that is passed along during application execution when using the pages related to manageable entities.

property.name: manageableReferenceParameterPrefix
property.documentation: The prefix used for hidden form input fields when pre-filling an entity reference after switching, this property should only be changed if you have form fields whose name could conflict with these extra fields.

property.name: manageableFieldMaxLength
property.documentation: The maximum number of characters to allow in a managed entity's table (remainder is truncated using an ellipsis).

propertyGroup.name: Validation and Security
propertyGroup.documentation: These properties configure the validation of user input as well as the security.

property.name: securityRealm
property.documentation: The security realm to use when security is enabled.

property.name: enableCaptcha
property.documentation: This property enable captcha on login page

property.name: clientValidation
property.documentation: Denotes whether or not the client (web browser) should validate user input.

property.name: serverValidation
property.documentation: Denotes whether or not the server should validate user input.

property.name: disableValidationForHiddenFormFields
property.documentation: This property only makes sense when using the clientValidation and/or serverValidation namespace properties, it instructs the cartridge to disable validation for form fields that are hidden from the end-user.

property.name: validatorPackage
property.documentation: The package to which the validator (containing extra commons-validator handlers) will be generated.

propertyGroup.name: Messages and i18n
propertyGroup.documentation: Properties related to the configuration of messages and internationalization in general.

property.name: normalizeMessages
property.documentation: Denotes the way application resource messages ought to be generated. When messages are normalized it means that elements with the same name will reuse the same label, even if they are located in entirely different use-cases or pages. This results in resource bundles that are not only smaller in size but also more straightforward to translate. The downside is that it will be less evident to customize labels for certain fields (which is rarely the case anyway). For backward compatibility reasons this flag is disabled by default.

property.name: successMessagesKey
property.documentation: The property used to identify success messages, all messages are stored in the default location for message used with Struts (in session scope, under Globals.MESSAGE_KEY), but this property distinguishes those mesage from the other ones. You would only need to change this value when you have messages already stored with this property and you want to avoid conflicts.

property.name: warningMessagesKey
property.documentation: The property used to identify warning messages, all messages are stored in the default location for message used with Struts (in session scope, under Globals.MESSAGE_KEY), but this property distinguishes those mesage from the other ones. You would only need to change this value when you have messages already stored with this property and you want to avoid conflicts.

property.name: errorMessagesKey
property.documentation: The property used to identify error messages, all messages are stored in the default location for message used with Struts (in session scope, under Globals.MESSAGE_KEY), but this property distinguishes those mesage from the other ones. You would only need to change this value when you have messages already stored with this property and you want to avoid conflicts.

propertyGroup.name: Other
propertyGroup.documentation: Other various properties that couldn't be classified into another category.

property.name: defaultActionRedirect
property.documentation: Whether or not redirection should occur on all action forwards.

property.name: actionPathPrefix
property.documentation: The pattern to use when rendering the action paths in struts-config.xml, use {0} for the package, /${use-case}/${action} is always appended. For use-case "org.andromda.test.My UseCase" the "login" action could be rendered using /abc/{0} which would result in /abc/org/andromda/test/MyUseCase/Login. Make sure to start the prefix using a forward slash character.

property.name: actionFormScope
property.documentation:
The default scope in which the action's form attribute will be placed when the action is executing. Normally it doesn't make sense to change this value from the default, however you may occasionaly need to override this value using the @andromda.struts.action.form.scope for a given action. The possible values are:
none - doesn't set the form attribute in any scope
request - sets the form attribute in the request scope
session - sets the form attribute in the session scope

property.name: servicePackageNamePattern
property.documentation: The name of the package in which to create the service files, {0} can be used to denote the package in which the service has been modeled.

property.name: serviceAccessorPattern
property.documentation:
The pattern to use when calling the backend code for <<Service>> lookups. For calling services you would use following patterns:
Spring: ${application.package}.ServiceLocator.instance().get{1}()
EJB: ${myPackage}.{1}Util.getHome().create()

property.name: generateTableDecorators
property.documentation: Whether or not to generate decorators for all tables.

property.name: tableDecoratorSuffix
property.documentation: The string to append to table decorator class names. The base name of the table equals the name of the parameter representing the table in the UML model, with the first character capitalized.

property.name: dummyData
property.documentation: Denotes whether or not to render dummy data in places like controllers.

property.name: exceptionHandlerPattern
property.documentation: Used to define the pattern used for retrieving message resource keys from exceptions. This is useful when exceptions are thrown from the business tier and you want to map these to messages in your presentation. Normally you won't need to change this pattern, however you may want to if you want to enable it to handle exceptions you may have no control over (i.e. SQLExceptions). Currently the default pattern supports an exception with an embedded {some.resource.key} type key.

property.name: exceptionHandlerPackage
property.documentation: The package to which the exception handler that retrieves exception keys will be generated.

property.name: servletPackage
property.documentation: The package to which the custom servlet (extending the default Struts ActionServlet) is generated.

property.name: formName
property.documentation: Defines the name of the form that is passed along during application execution. This attribute is passed along in the session (usually, can also be request if actionFormScope has been changed or its corresponding tagged value changed). You'll normally never need to modify this value.

property.name: xmlEncoding
property.documentation: Encoding for generated XML files.

property.name: pageEncoding
property.documentation: Encoding for the responses sent back by the server (the pages).

property.name: languages
property.documentation: Languages that the application supports.

property.name: customServlets
property.documentation: Customized servlets.

property.name: serviceLocatorName
property.documentation: Nome da classe ServiceLocator

property.name: controleAcessoDir
property.documentation: Diretorio onde se encontra o diretorio do login

property.name: secureDir
property.documentation: Diretorio onde se encontra o diretorio do seguranca

property.name: enableHttpsRequest
property.documentation: Diretorio onde se encontra o diretorio do seguranca

property.name: secureServerPort
property.documentation: Porta utilizada com protocolo https

property.name: serverPort
property.documentation: Porta utilizada com protocolo http

property.name: mainDir
property.documentation: Diretorio onde se encontra o diretorio principal

property.name: generateWebXmlIds
property.documentation: Indicates whether or not to generate id attributes in the elements of the web.xml descriptor. Some application servers such as WebSphere need them, other application servers such as Resin can't handle them.

property.name: maxRows
property.documentation: Number of rows by page

property.name: cadastroSessionObjectName
property.documentation: List of session Objects and their useCase on Session

property.name: pbiDir
property.documentation: Diretorio onde sao gerados os PBIs

property.name: utilDir
property.documentation: Diretorio onde sao gerados os arquivos utilitarios

property.name: servicePackageName
property.documentation: Nome do pacote de servicos

property.name: webPackageName
property.documentation: Nome do pacote de apresentacao.

property.name: moduloWebPrincipal
property.documentation: Estereotipo do modulo web Principal.

property.name: compartilhadoJarDir
property.documentation: Diretorio onde o jar compartilhado esta

property.name: homeURI
property.documentation: variavel de ambiente que define a url do projeto

property.name: inputOperationMode
property.documentation: Modo de operacao a ser utilizado - aplicado na aï¿½o que chama o estado final

property.name: keepOperationMode
property.documentation: Informa se ï¿½ou nï¿½ para manter o modo de operaï¿½o atual

property.name: keepSO
property.documentation: Informa se um session object serï¿½persistido na sessï¿½

property.name: radioSelected
property.documentation: Informa qual elemento do radio estara selecionado

property.name: operationMode
property.documentation: Modo de operacao que pode visualizar a aï¿½o

property.name: externalModuleName
property.documentation: Informa o modulo web que contem o caso de uso externo

property.name: externalHyperlinkApplicationName
property.documentation: Informa o nome da aplicacao que contem o modulo e o caso de uso externo

property.name: externalHyperlinkModulo
property.documentation: Informa o modulo web que contem o caso de uso externo

property.name: externalHyperlink
property.documentation: Informa o link para a action do caso de uso externo

property.name: fieldOperationMode
property.documentation: Modo de operacao que pode visualizar o campo

property.name: breadCrumbInput
property.documentation: Inclui o caso de uso no bread crumb.

property.name: breadCrumbLabel
property.documentation: Coloca um nome do caso de uso no bread crumb.

property.name: reportPropertiesPath
property.documentation: caminho onde se encontra o arquivo de propriedades de report

property.name: timeout
property.documentation: Tempo de sessao do usuario em minutos

property.name: ServiceFactorySelectNodeName
property.documentation: Nome que identifica qual Servico sera chamado pela Factory

property.name: confirmMessage
property.documentation: Indicacao de ter exigencia de confirmacao

property.name: demanda
property.documentation: Indicacao se o controle de acesso sera feito por demanda ou nao

property.name: copy
property.documentation: Caso seja falso , não possibilita a cópia dos parametros da transição de um caso de uso para o outro

property.name: loggerName
property.documentation: Indica o nome do Logger

property.name: loggerPackage
property.documentation: Indica o pacote do logger

property.name: invalidInputCharacters
property.documentation: Caracteres que nao podem ser usados nos campos de entrada de dados do sistema

property.name: tarefasAgendadas
property.documentation: Valor que denota o acionamento do agendamento de tarefas

property.name: aplicacaoDistribuida
property.documentation: Informa a utilizacao do ambiente em cluster

property.name: maxTentativasLogin
property.documentation: Limite de tentativas falhas de login tolerado, apos o qual o usuario eh bloqueado.

property.name: oAuthServer
property.documentation: Indica que o sistema deve ser um servidor oAuth

property.name: struts2
property.documentation: Indica se o projeto usara Struts 2 como padrao.
